{{Day}}

==Events==
* [[314]] &ndash; [[Roman Emperor]] [[Licinius]] is defeated by his colleague [[Constantine I]] at the [[Battle of Cibalae]], and loses his European territories.
* [[451]] &ndash; At [[Chalcedon]], a city of [[Bithynia]] in [[Asia Minor]], the first session of the [[Council of Chalcedon]] begins (ends on November 1).
*[[1075]] &ndash; [[Demetrius Zvonimir of Croatia|Dmitar Zvonimir]] is crowned King of [[Kingdom of Croatia (medieval)|Croatia]].
*[[1200]] &ndash; [[Isabella of Angoulême]] is crowned [[List of English consorts|Queen consort of England]].
*[[1322]] &ndash; [[Mladen II Šubić of Bribir]], defeated in the [[battle of Bliska]], is arrested by the Parliament.
*[[1480]] &ndash; [[Great standing on the Ugra river]], a standoff between the forces of [[Akhmat Khan]], [[Khan (title)|Khan]] of the [[Great Horde]], and the [[Grand Duke]] [[Ivan III]] of [[Russia]], which results in the retreat of the [[Timeline of the Tataro-Mongol Yoke in Russia|Tataro-Mongols]] and the eventual disintegration of the Horde.
*[[1573]] &ndash; End of the Spanish [[siege of Alkmaar]], the first Dutch victory in [[Eighty Years War]].
*[[1582]] &ndash; Because of the implementation of the [[Gregorian calendar]] this day does not exist in this year in [[Italy]], [[Poland]], [[Portugal]] and [[Spain]].
*[[1600]] &ndash; [[San Marino]] adopts its written constitution.
*[[1645]] &ndash; [[Jeanne Mance]] opened the [[Hôtel-Dieu de Montréal]], the first lay hospital in North America.
*[[1806]] &ndash; [[Napoleonic Wars]]: Forces of the [[British Empire]] lay siege to the port of [[Boulogne]] in [[France]] by using [[Congreve rockets]], invented by [[Sir William Congreve, 2nd Baronet|Sir William Congreve]].
*[[1813]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Ried]] is signed between [[Bayern]] and [[Austria]].
*[[1821]] &ndash; The government of general [[José de San Martín]] establishes the [[Peruvian Navy]].
*[[1829]] &ndash; [[1829 in rail transport|Rail transport]]: [[George Stephenson|Stephenson]]'s ''[[Stephenson's Rocket|The Rocket]]'' wins [[Rainhill Trials|The Rainhill Trials]].
*[[1856]] &ndash; The [[Second Opium War]] between several western powers and [[China]] begins with the ''Arrow Incident'' on the [[Pearl River (China)|Pearl River]].
*[[1860]] &ndash; [[Telegraph line]] between [[Los Angeles]] and [[San Francisco]] opens.
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Perryville]] &ndash; [[United States|Union]] forces under General [[Don Carlos Buell]] halt the [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] invasion of [[Kentucky]] by defeating troops led by General [[Braxton Bragg]] at [[Perryville, Kentucky]].
*[[1871]] &ndash; Four major fires break out on the shores of [[Lake Michigan]] in [[Chicago]], [[Peshtigo, Wisconsin]], [[Holland, Michigan]], and [[Manistee, Michigan]] including the [[Great Chicago Fire]], and the much deadlier [[Peshtigo Fire]].
*[[1879]] &ndash; [[War of the Pacific]]: the [[Chilean Navy]] defeats the [[Peruvian Navy]] in the [[Battle of Angamos]], Peruvian Admiral [[Miguel Grau Seminario|Miguel Grau]] is killed in the encounter.
*[[1895]] &ndash; [[Empress Myeongseong of Korea#Eulmi Incident|Eulmi incident]]- [[Empress Myeongseong of Korea|Queen Min of Joseon]], the last [[empress]] of [[Korea]], is assassinated and her corpse burnt by Japanese infiltrators inside [[Gyeongbok Palace]].
*[[1904]] &ndash; [[Edmonton, Alberta]] is incorporated as a city.
*  1904   &ndash; [[Prince Albert, Saskatchewan]] is incorporated as a city.
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[Balkan Wars|First Balkan War]] begins: [[Montenegro]] declares war against the [[Ottoman Empire]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: In the [[Forest of Argonne|Argonne Forest]] in [[France]], [[United States]] Corporal [[Alvin C. York]] kills 28 [[German Empire|German]] soldiers and captures 132, for which he is awarded the [[Medal of Honor]].
*[[1921]] &ndash; [[KDKA (AM)|KDKA]] in [[Pittsburgh]]'s [[Forbes Field]] conducts the first live broadcast of a football game.
*[[1928]] &ndash; [[Joseph Szigeti]] gives the first performance of [[Alfredo Casella]]'s Violin Concerto.
*[[1932]] &ndash; The [[Indian Air Force]] is established.
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Germany]] annexes Western [[Poland]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; World War II: In their invasion of the [[Soviet Union]], [[Germany]] reaches the [[Sea of Azov]] with the capture of [[Mariupol]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Battle of Crucifix Hill]] occurs on [[Crucifix Hill]] just outside [[Aachen]]. [[Bobbie E. Brown|Capt. Bobbie Brown]] receives a [[Medal of Honor]] for his heroics in this battle.
*[[1952]] &ndash; The [[Harrow and Wealdstone rail crash]] kills 112 people.
*[[1956]] &ndash; [[New York Yankees]]'s [[Don Larsen]] pitched the only [[perfect game]] in a [[World Series]]; one of only 21 perfect games in [[MLB]] history.
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[Spiegel scandal]]: ''[[Der Spiegel]]'' publishes the article ''"Bedingt abwehrbereit"'' (''"Conditionally prepared for defense"'') about a [[NATO]] manoeuvre called "Fallex 62", which uncovered the sorry state of the [[Bundeswehr]] (Germany's army) facing the [[communist]] threat from the east at the time. The magazine is soon accused of [[treason]].
*  1962   &ndash; [[Algeria]] joins the [[United Nations]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; Guerrilla leader [[Che Guevara]] and his men are captured in [[Bolivia]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: [[Operation Sealords]] &ndash; [[United States]] and [[South Vietnam]]ese forces launch a new operation in the [[Mekong Delta]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; The opening rally of the [[Days of Rage]] occurs, organized by the [[Weatherman (organization)|Weather Underground]] in [[Chicago, Illinois]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; Vietnam War: In [[Paris]], a [[Communism|Communist]] delegation rejects US President [[Richard Nixon]]'s October 7 peace proposal as "a manoeuvre to deceive world opinion".
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Yom Kippur War]]: Gabi Amir's armored [[brigade]] attacks Egyptian occupied positions on the Israeli side of the [[Suez Canal]], in hope of driving them away. The attack fails, and over 150 Israeli tanks are destroyed.
*  1973   &ndash; [[Greek military junta of 1967–1974]]: Junta strongman [[George Papadopoulos]] appoints [[Spyros Markezinis]] as [[Prime Minister of Greece]] with the task to lead Greece to parliamentary rule.
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Franklin National Bank]] collapses due to fraud and mismanagement; at the time it is the largest bank failure in the history of the [[United States]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[Australia]]'s [[Ken Warby]] sets the current world [[water speed record]] of 317.60&nbsp;mph at Blowering Dam, Australia.
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[Poland]] bans [[Solidarity (Polish trade union)|Solidarity]] and all [[trade union]]s.
*  1982   &ndash; [[Cats (musical)|''Cats'']] opens on Broadway and runs for nearly 18 years before closing on September 10, 2000.
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Israeli-Palestinian Conflict]]: In [[Jerusalem]], [[Israel]]i police kill 17 [[Palestinian people|Palestinian]]s and wound over 100 near the [[Dome of the Rock]] mosque on the [[Temple Mount]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Croatia]] votes to sever constitutional relations with [[Yugoslavia]], rendering the country fully independent.
*[[2001]] &ndash; A twin engine [[Cessna]] and [[Scandinavian Airlines System]] (SAS) jetliner [[Linate Airport disaster|collide in heavy fog during takeoff]] from [[Milan, Italy]] killing 118 people.
*  2001   &ndash; [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[George W. Bush]] announces the establishment of the [[United States Department of Homeland Security|Office of Homeland Security]].
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[2005 Kashmir earthquake]]: Thousands of people are killed by a magnitude 7.6 [[earthquake]] in parts of [[Pakistan]], [[India]] and [[Afghanistan]].

==Holidays and observances==
*[[Indian Air Force|Air Force Day]] ([[India]])
*Christian [[Calendar of saints|Feast Day]]:
**[[Palatias and Laurentia]]
**[[Saint Pelagia|Pelagia]] ([[Roman Catholic Church]])
**[[William Dwight Porter Bliss]] and [[Richard T. Ely]] ([[Episcopal Church (USA)]])
**[[October 8 (Eastern Orthodox liturgics)]]
*Earliest day on which [[Columbus Day#United States observance|Columbus Day]] can fall, while October 14 is the latest; observed on the second Monday of October ([[United States]])
*Earliest day on which [[Discoverer's Day#Local observances|Discoverer's Day]] can fall, while October 14 is the latest; observed on the second Monday of October ([[Hawaii]])
*Earliest date on which the first day of [[Fire Prevention Week]] can fall, while October 14 is the latest; observed on the second week of October. ([[United States]] and [[Canada]])
*Earliest day on which [[International Day for Natural Disaster Reduction]] can fall, while October 14 is the latest; observed on the second Wednesday of October ([[Hawaii]])
*[[Independence Day (Croatia)|Independence Day]], celebrates the official separation of [[Croatia]] from [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|Yugoslavia]] in 1991.
*[[Peruvian Navy|Navy Day]] ([[Peru]])
*Latest day on which Mid-Autumn Festival can fall, while September 8 is the earliest; celebrated on the 15th day in the 8th month of [[Chinese calendar]]. ([[China]])
